alert.note: Alert for Knox; Lewis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 02 at 2:56AM CDT until August 02 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, and northeast Missouri, including the following areas, in central Missouri, Audrain MO, Boone MO, Callaway MO and Cole MO. In east central Missouri, Montgomery MO. In northeast Missouri, Knox MO, Lewis MO, Marion MO, Monroe MO, Ralls MO and Shelby MO. * WHEN...Until 10 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall rates continue this morning. Areas which see persistent thunderstorms could see very high rainfall amounts and flash flooding.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
